text: The Bombardier 3.8 is a Canadian sailing dinghy, first built in 1974. The design is a development of the 1973 Bombardier Invitation, although smaller and lighter. The boat was sold in Sweden as the Triss Racer. ==Production== The design was built by Bombardier Limited in Canada, but it is now out of production. ==Design== The Bombardier 3.8 is a recreational sailboat, built predominantly of fiberglass. It has an unstayed catboat rig, a raked stem, vertical transom, a wooden transom-hung rudder controlled by a tiller and a wooden daggerboard keel. It displaces . The boat has a draft of with the daggerboard down and with it retracted, allowing beaching or ground transportation on a trailer or car top. ==See also== *List of sailing boat types Related development *Bombardier Invitation Similar sailboats *Laser (dinghy) ==References== Category:Dinghies Category:1970s sailboat type designs Category:Sailing yachts
